title: Typefaces for special applications
content:
Recently I have seen some interesting numerals on dials of timepieces. Two questions here:

1) Have you seen some extraordinarily nice (custom) numbers on clocks/watches?

2) What other unusual sources of fine custom numbers or alphabets come to your mind (besides those H&FJ Numbers)?

Thanks for your input.
author: loremipsum

comments.content:
_Have you seen some extraordinarily nice (custom) numbers on clocks/watches?_

I've been _waiting_ for this thread to motivate me to snap pics of our grandfather clock to post!

What do you make of these? (Apologies for the blurriness of the closeups.)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153254im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_1077_4395.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153254im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_1076_6694.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153254im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_1079_5209.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153254im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_1080_4041.jpg)

I love the 9-like 2 and the long hairline bits.
That's what I am talking about. This clock would never caused all these Uhhhhs and Ahhhhs if it was set in helvetica.

[Here's](http://web.archive.org/web/20141124153254/http:/www.istockphoto.com/file_closeup/concepts-and-ideas/time/6302326-eleven-o-clock.php?id=6302326) a pic that my father took of his antique clock.
